medical_history.chief_complaint: Lower abdominal pain and change in bowel habits for the last 5 days.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began gradually with cramping in the lower abdomen. Patient experienced frequent bowel movements with mucus and solid small amounts every hour for the last 2 days. Reports urgency and dark tea color urine without hematuria. Diaphoresis was noted on the previous night. No fever or chills. Denies nausea/vomiting and dysuria, but reports increased urinary frequency. Appetite decreased due to pain.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Past medical history is not specified; however, the patient had a left inguinal hernia as an infant.
